curated_text: Symbol: UNH. Year: 2022. Period: Q1. ReportType: Q10. Section: Competition and Market Position. This section discusses competitors, market dynamics, and regulatory landscape.  Competitors mentioned: COVID-19 Trends and Uncertainties, COVID-19, UnitedHealthcare, Consolidated, UnitedHealth Group, Diluted, 0.3 Tax, Medicare Advantage, Medicaid, MCR, the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements, Optum Health, UnitedHealthcare Employer & Individual - Domestic, UnitedHealthcare Employer & Individual - Global, UnitedHealthcare Employer & Individual - Total, UnitedHealthcare Medicare & Retirement, UnitedHealthcare Community & State, Total UnitedHealthcare, UnitedHealthcare Global, UnitedHealthcare Employer & Individual, Medicare, Optum Total, Optum Health Revenues, Optum Insight, CAPITAL RESOURCES Liquidity Summary, 279 Total, CMS, Financial Condition, Contents Capital Resources, Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition, Short-Term Borrowings, the Consolidated Financial Statements, Moody’s S&P, A3 Positive A+ Stable, Board of Directors, the Company’s Board of Directors, Business Combinations, Change Healthcare, LHC Group, Inc., Consolidated Financial Statements. Context excerpt: competition to continue as the industry adapts to individual and employer needs. Government programs in the community and senior sector tend to receive lower rates of increase than the commercial market due to governmental budget pressures and lower cost trends. Medical Cost Trends. Our medical cost trends primarily relate to changes in unit costs, health system utilization and prescription drug costs. COVID-19 related care and testing costs as well as the deferral of care have also impacted medical cost trends in the current year and may continue in future years. We endeavor to mitigate those increases by engaging physicians 17 Table of Contents and consumers with information and helping them make clinically sound choices, with the objective of helping them achieve high-quality, affordable care. COVID-19 Trends and Uncertainties During the nine months ended September 30, 2022, overall care was near normal baseline levels, with certain areas of care at or approaching seasonal baselines
